posts.post_content:
Combos well with 1 damage cards ([Gore Vassal](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gore Vassal), [Chandra, the Firebrand](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Chandra, the Firebrand), etc.).
  
   
A lot better than [Diminish](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Diminish) as it removes pesky trigger abilities.
  
   
My son has been giggling over this card ever since I showed it to him since one of his favorite cards is [Ovinomancer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ovinomancer).
  
   
This is one of those cards that just makes you smile when you look at it.
posts.html:
Combos well with 1 damage cards (Gore Vassal, Chandra, the Firebrand, etc.).

A lot better than Diminish as it removes pesky trigger abilities.

My son has been giggling over this card ever since I showed it to him since one of his favorite cards is Ovinomancer.

This is one of those cards that just makes you smile when you look at it.

Rating:

posts.post_content:
Odd that it's currently rated slightly higher than [Ovinize](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ovinize). I guess giving it the Frog creature type totally makes up for leaving it with 1 power. =)  
  
Could come back to bite you if your opponent's playing [Frog](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Frog) Tribal, though. :p  
  
Alternately, play a couple [Adaptive Automaton](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Adaptive Automaton)s and name Frog. Then play [Turn to Frog](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Turn to Frog) on your non-frog creatures. Sure, they may laugh now, but just you wait...
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
http://www.wizards.com/Magic/Magazine/Article.aspx?x=mtg/daily/stf/151  
  
"This card was designed to match the art. Interestingly, the art was originally commissioned for an Esper spell back in Shards of Alara block—you can kind of see a subtle hint of etherium filigree shapes in the fallen armor. The card was killed, so the art didn't get used in that block, but we held onto it, knowing that the art would work fine on a more setting-neutral core set card—and here it is. Given the art, designing what the spell did was pretty straightforward. "
posts.html:
http://www.wizards.com/Magic/Magazine/Article.aspx?x=mtg/daily/stf/151

Posted By: Gelzo (7/9/2011 12:36:32 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
First, The best flavor text ever is obviously on Distress!!  
  
*"Of course I'm sure I've gone mad. The little man who crawled out of my eye was quite clear on this."*  
  
  
Regardless of the flavor text, playing control in limited this card is absolutely bonkers!!! Turning any creature you want into a 1/1 frog you can step on, after they have already declared who is attacking... Are you kidding me? I can turn Blightsteel into a frog and kill him by blocking with my memnite... uh um OK!!!   
  
The best use of this that I have had so far is to turn my grave titan that someone cast act of treason on into a 1/1 frog... Sorry!!

posts.post_content: I am dissappointed that this can't be used to counter copy spells. I was playing online and somebody goes to copy a transformed werewolf so I counter with turn to frog. The glitches that followed were spectacular, but upon investigation the ruling on copy spells say that the copy is of the base card and it even gets to keep it's original power and toughness. Totally lame judges....totally lame.
